article.title: Darwin_Awards
article.paragraph:
Aboutthe Royal Society awardDarwin Medalthe 2006 filmThe Darwin Awards (film)Infobox WebsiteDarwin Awards [[File:Darwinaward.png]]
{{url|http://www.darwinawards.com/}} Yes [[Humor]] English Wendy Northcutt 1993-2014 137,718<ref nameactive (as of 2014SEP02)
TheDarwin Awardsare atongue-in-cheekhonor, originating inUsenetnewsgroup discussions circa 1985. They recognize individuals who have supposedly contributed to human evolution bynatural selectionselectingthemselves out of thegene poolviadeathorSterilization (medicine)sterilizationby their own actions.

The project became more formalized with the creation of awebsitein 1993, and followed up by a series ofbooksstarting in 2000, authored byWendy Northcutt. The criterion for the awards states, "In the spirit ofCharles Darwin, the Darwin Awards commemorate individuals who protect our gene pool by making the ultimate sacrifice of their own lives. Darwin Award winnersdeatheliminate themselvesin an extraordinarily idiotic manner, thereby improving our species' chances of long-term survival."cite webNorthcuttWendyHistory & Rules.http://www.darwinawards.com/rules/rules1.html[http://www.darwinawards.com/ www.darwinawards.com]August 14, 2012

Accidental self-sterilization also qualifies; however, the site notes: "Of necessity, the award is usually bestowed posthumously." But the candidate is disqualified if "innocent bystanders", who might have contributed positively to the gene pool, are killed in the process.

The Darwin Awards books state that an attempt is made to disallow knownurban legendsfrom the awards, but some older "winners" have been "Grandfather clausegrandfathered" to keep their awards. The Darwin Awards site does try to verify all submitted stories, but many similar sites, and the vast number of circulating "Darwin awards" emails, are largely fictional.
article.heading: History
article.paragraph: File:Wendy Northcutt.jpgthumbrightWendy Northcutt, author of the Darwin Awards website and booksThe origin of the Darwin Awards can be traced back to posts onUsenetgroup discussions as early as 1985. This early post, on August 7, 1985, describes the awards as being, "given posthumously to people who have made the supreme sacrifice to keep their genes out of ourgene poolpool. Style counts, not everyone who dies from their own stupidity can win."cite newsFreemanAndyDarwin Awards.https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups#!msg/net.bizarre/V5o__gcmIf0/fZ5sv2BvzAsJ%5B1-25%5DAugust 14, 2012[[Google groups]] archive of net.bizarre.August 7, 1985This early post cites an example of a person who pulled avending machineover their head and was crushed to death trying to break into it.Another widely distributed early story mentioning the Darwin Awards is theJATO Rocket Car, which describes a man who strapped aJATO(Jet-Assisted Take-Off) unit to hisChevrolet Impalain theArizonadesert and who died gloriously on the side of a cliff as his car achieved speeds of 250 to 300 miles per hour.cite newsWilsonScottEvolution in Action.https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups#!msg/rec.motorcycles/toqDYRyGarM/pe9WuO1E4ZIJ%5B1-25%5DAugust 14, 2012[[Google groups]] archive of rec.motorcycles.December 7, 1990This story was later confirmed to be anurban legendby the Arizona Department of Public Safety.cite newsMikkelsonBarbaraCarmageddon.http://www.snopes.com/autos/dream/jato.aspAugust 14, 2012[[Snopes]]November 12, 2006The official Darwin Awards website run by Northcutt does its best to confirm all stories submitted, listing them as, "confirmed true by Darwin." Many of theviral emailscirculating theInternet, however, are hoaxes and urban legends.cite newsMikkelsonBarbara2004 Darwin Awards.http://www.snopes.com/horrors/freakish/darwin04.aspAugust 14, 2012[[Snopes]]July 3, 2010

Thewebsiteand collection ofbookswere started in 1993 by Wendy Northcutt, who at the time was a graduate inmolecular biologyfrom theUniversity of California, Berkeley.cite bookRiceStanley A.Encyclopedia of EvolutionDarwin Awards2007Facts on FileNew York0-8160-5515-7108https://books.google.com/books?idShe went on to studyneurobiologyatStanford University, doing research oncancerandtelomerase. In her spare time, she organizedchain lettersfrom family members into the original Darwin Awards website hosted in her personal account space at Stanford. She eventually left the bench in 1998 and devoted herself full-time to her website and books in September 1999.cite newsHawkinsJohnA Conversation with Darwin (Webmaster of the Darwin Awards).http://www.rightwingnews.com/interviews/darwin.phpAugust 14, 2012[http://www.rightwingnews.com/ Right Wing News]By 2002, the website received 7 million page hits per month.cite newsClarkDougLet's hear it for natural selection.http://www.spokesmanreview.com/news-story.asp?dateSeptember 18, 2012[[The Spokesman-Review]]November 14, 2002

She encountered some difficulty in publishing the first book, since most publishers would only offer her a deal if she agreed to remove the stories from theInternet. Northcutt refused to do so, saying, It was a community! I could not do that. Even though it might have cost me a lot of money, I kept saying no. She eventually found a publisher who agreed to print the book containing only 10% of the material. The first book turned out to be a success, and was listed on theNew York Timesbestseller list for six months.cite newsJohnPet porn, rocket cars and hand grenades.http://www.123-reg.co.uk/blog/interviews/darwin-awards-pet-porn-and-hand-grenades/August 31, 2012[http://www.123-reg.co.uk/ 123-reg]April 14, 2008

Not all of the feedback from the stories Northcutt published was positive, and she would occasionally receive email from people who knew the deceased. One such person wrote, "This is horrible. It has shocked our community to the core. You should remove this." Nevertheless, Northcutt would keep the stories on the website and in her books, citing them as a "funny-but-true safety guide", and mentioning that children who read the book are going to be a lot more careful around explosives.cite news'Darwin Awards' author dedicated to documenting macabre mishaps.http://articles.cnn.com/2001-01-03/entertainment/darwin.awards_1_deaths-darwin-award-wendy-northcuttSeptember 18, 2012[[CNN]]January 3, 2001

The website also recognizes, with Honorable Mentions, individuals who survive their misadventures with their reproductive capacity intact. One example of this isLarry WaltersLawnchair Larry, who attachedheliumfilledweather balloonsto a lawn chair and floated far aboveLong Beach, California, in July 1982. He reached an altitude ofconvert16000ftmbut survived, to be later fined for crossingcontrolled airspace.cite newsGreany, Ed; Walker, Douglas; Hecht, Walter.Lawn Chair Larry.http://darwinawards.com/stupid/stupid1998-11.htmlAugust 14, 2012[http://www.darwinawards.com/ www.darwinawards.com]Another notable honorable mention was given to the two men who attempted to burgle the home of footballerDuncan Ferguson(who had four convictions for assault and had served six months in Glasgow'sBarlinnie prison) in 2001, with one burglar requiring three days' hospitalization after being confronted by the player.cite newsMcSean, Tony; Nash, Pete.Ferguson 2, Thieves 0.http://darwinawards.com/stupid/stupid2001-04.htmlAugust 14, 2012[http://www.darwinawards.com/ www.darwinawards.com]

File:Lendrem_et_al.-2014-Figure_1-The_Darwin_Awards_sex_differences_in_idiotic_behavior.jpgthumbrightalt=Figure charting sex differences between Darwin Award winners, 19952014"Male and female Darwin Award winners. Line H0indicates expected percentages under the null hypothesis that males and females are equally idiotic"A 2014 study published in theBritish Medical Journalfound that between 19952014 males represented 88.7% of Darwin Award winners (see figure).Cite journal10.1136/bmj.g7094349g7094LendremBen Alexander DanielLendremDennis WilliamGrayAndyIsaacsJohn DudleyThe Darwin Awards: sex differences in idiotic behaviourBMJ2015-09-242014-12-11http://www.bmj.com/content/349/bmj.g709425500113open access
A 2006comedy film,The Darwin Awards (film)The Darwin Awards, written and directed byFinn Taylor, was based on the website and many of the Darwin Awards stories.
article.heading: Rules
article.paragraph: Northcutt has stated five requirements for a Darwin Award:cite newsHansenSuzyThe Darwin Awardshttp://www.salon.com/2000/11/10/northcutt/September 18, 2012[[Salon (website)|Salon]]November 10, 2000
article.heading: Inability to reproduce

list.listitem: Nominee must be dead or rendered sterile.

Sometimes this can be a matter of dispute. Potential awardees may be out of the gene pool because of age; others have already reproduced before their deaths. To avoid debates about the possibility ofin-vitro fertilization,artificial insemination, orhuman cloningcloning, the original Darwin Awards book applied the following "deserted island" test to potential winners: If the person were unable to reproduce when stranded on a deserted island with a fertile member of the opposite sex, he or she would be considered sterile.cite bookNorthcuttWendyThe Darwin Awards: Evolution in Action2000PLUME (The Penguin Group)[[New York City]]0-525-94572-52â€“6http://books.google.com/?idWinners of the award, in general, either are dead or have become unable to use theirsexual organs.

article.heading: Excellence

list.listitem: The candidate's foolishness must be unique and sensational, likely because the award is intended to be funny. A number of foolish but common activities, such as smoking in bed, are excluded from consideration. In contrast,self-immolationcaused by smoking after being administered a flammable ointment in a hospital and specifically told not to smoke is grounds for nomination.cite webC.J.; Malcolm, Andrew; Sims, Iain; Beeston, Richard.Stubbed Out.http://darwinawards.com/darwin/darwin2006-06.html[http://www.darwinawards.com/ www.darwinawards.com]August 15, 2012One 'Honorable Mention' (a man who attempted suicide by swallowingGlyceryl trinitrate (pharmacology)nitroglycerine pills, and then tried to detonate them by running into a wall) is noted to be in this category, despite being intentional and self-inflicted, which would normally disqualify the inductee.cite webCawcuttTomPhenomenal Failure.http://darwinawards.com/stupid/stupid2001-24.html[http://www.darwinawards.com/ www.darwinawards.com]August 15, 2012

article.heading: Self-selection

list.listitem: Killing a friend with ahand grenadewould not be eligible, but killing oneself while manufacturing a homemadechimney-cleaning device from a grenade would be eligible.cite webNorthcutt, WendyChimney-Cleaning Grenade.http://darwinawards.com/darwin/darwin2005-09.html[http://www.darwinawards.com/ www.darwinawards.com]2005August 15, 2012To earn a Darwin Award, one must have killed oneself; merely causing death to a third party is insufficient.

article.heading: Maturity

list.listitem: The nominee must be at least past the legal driving age and free ofintellectual disabilitymental defect(Northcutt considers injury or death caused by mental defect to be tragic, rather than amusing, and routinely disqualifies such entries). After much discussion, there also exists a small category regarding deaths below this age limit. Entry into this category requires that the peers of the candidate be of the opinion that the actions of the person in question were above and beyond the limits of reason.

article.paragraph: However, in 2011 the awards targeted a 16-year-old boy in Leeds who died stealing copper wiring (the standard minimum driving age in Great Britain being 17). In 2012, Northcutt made similar light of a 14-year-old girl in Brazil who was killed while leaning out of a school bus window, however "disqualified" the award itself because the likely public objection due to her age, which she asserts is based on "magical thinking."http://homoeconomicusnet.wordpress.com/2012/12/10/darwin-awards-2012-too-young-to-include/
article.heading: Veracity

list.listitem: The story must be documented by reliable sources: e.g., reputable newspaper articles, confirmed television reports, or responsible eyewitnesses. If a story is found to be untrue, it is disqualified, but particularly amusing ones are placed in theurban legendsection of the archives. Despite this requirement, many of the stories are fictional, often appearing as "original submissions" and presenting no further sources than unverified (and unreliable) "eyewitnesses." Most such stories on Northcutt's Darwin Awards site are filed in the Personal Accounts section.

article.paragraph: In addition, later revisions to the qualification criteria add several requirements that have not been made into formalized 'rules': innocent bystanders cannot be in danger, and the qualifying eventmustbe caused without deliberate intent (to prevent glory-seekers from purposely injuring themselves solely to win a Darwin).
article.heading: Relationship to the theory of natural selection
article.paragraph: The Darwin Awards are named afterCharles Darwinbecause of his theory ofnatural selection. However, there is no evidence that the stories depicted actually represent the removal of "judgement impairment genes" from thegene pool. While the stories depict a lack ofintelligencein many of the individuals, nogeneticdifferences between Darwin Award winners and the rest of humankind have been sought or demonstrated. Fatal stupidity could be culturally acquired during upbringing andsocialization. The stories may actually represent excessiveimpulsiveness, which can result from a variety of factors.
